image.altText: A man and a woman stand in a suburban setting looking at the camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Nick and Aimee Mazza's hard-earned cash was gambled away by a man they thought was investing it. Bookmakers encouraged him to keep betting.

title.children: Their money was stolen and gambled away. Betting companies won't give it back

image.altText: Aluminum containers containing rice, tofu, fried fish, vegetables, and melon slices.

props.synopsis: The key election commitment of President Prabowo Subianto is facing mounting backlash over its poor oversight, questionable food sourcing and unhygienic kitchens.

title.children: Indonesia's free meal program poisons thousands of children

image.altText: A blue metal train carriage exterior surrounded by charred broken wood and with orange flames and smoke seen through a window

props.synopsis: A Russian drone strike has hit a passenger train in Ukraine's northern Sumy region and injured dozens of people in an act President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has denounced as 'terrorism'.

title.children: Russian strike hits Ukrainian passenger train, authorities say

image.altText: Sean Diddy Combs looking at something with sunglasses on

props.synopsis: Sean "Diddy" Combs may have just been sentenced to four years in prison, but he still faces a mountain of lawsuits accusing him of sexual violence and other misconduct.

title.children: Here's what's next for Sean 'Diddy' Combs now he's been sentenced to four years in prison

image.altText: A photo of people wearing black shirts with prints, holding protest signs, photos and flowers

props.synopsis: Around 600 people attend a justice march for Kaiden Morgan-Johnston, who died after he was allegedly stabbed while walking to a friend's house in Morwell.

title.children: Community unites to demand justice for beloved Aboriginal dancer

image.altText: Andrew Hastie speaks in a corridor in Parliament House

props.synopsis: Hastie says he decided to quit because a letter she sent him earlier in the week made clear he wouldn't be formulating the Coalition's immigration policies.

title.children: Andrew Hastie's resignation could not be worse timing for Sussan Ley

image.altText: A group of rugby players wrestle for the ball in wet conditions

props.synopsis: Australia's hopes of an unlikely Rugby Championship triumph have been extinguished with a 28-14 loss to New Zealand.

title.children: Professional All Blacks outclass Wallabies at wet and wild Perth Stadium

image.altText: Australian players embrace as they celebrate their win over South Africa in the first netball Test.

props.synopsis: Australia has overcome a promising start from South Africa to win 64-53 in the first netball Test in Bendigo.

title.children: Diamonds prevail against plucky Proteas in opening Test

image.altText: Reece Walsh takes a shot at goal during an NRL game.

props.synopsis: Kick-off times, pre-game entertainment and all the players taking the field. Here's everything you need to know for grand final day in Sydney.

title.children: What time are the NRL and NRLW grand finals?

image.altText: Mitchell Marsh hits out for Australia against New Zealand in a men's T20I.

props.synopsis: Mitch Marsh's first T20I century helped the Australian men's team record a stunning three-wicket win over New Zealand across the Tasman.

title.children: Marsh inspires Aussies to T20I win over Black Caps

image.altText: A man in a suit points and looks on.

props.synopsis: A Queensland man is charged with using a carriage service to make a threat to kill after he allegedly made a threat on Anthony Albanese's life on social media.

title.children: Man charged over alleged death threat to prime minister

image.altText: Satellite images show a build up of military vehicles inside a square in Gaza City

props.synopsis: Israeli troops are moving closer and closer to the heart of Gaza City, razing rows of buildings and converting tent cities into front lines, an ABC News analysis of satellite images shows.

title.children: Hundreds of Israeli military vehicles seen in imagery surrounding Gaza City

image.altText: A fire at the beach

props.synopsis: Campers on Moreton Island, off the coast of south-east Queensland, have been evacuated and nearby residents told to prepare to leave as a large, out-of-control bushfire burns in the island's north.

title.children: Campers evacuated as Moreton Island bushfire intensifies

image.altText: Soccer players in red and blue celebrate scoring a goal

props.synopsis: The Newcastle Jets have defeated semi-professional club Heidelberg United 3-1 to claim their first silverware since 2008.

title.children: Jets down Heidelberg to win Australia Cup

image.altText: A lady with short black hair sitting in-front of a microphone

props.synopsis: The decision comes after the Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba announced his resignation last month.

title.children: Sanae Takaichi likely to become Japan's first female PM

image.altText: Concrete building lay in ruins across a wide horizon against a grey sky.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says he believes Hamas has shown it is "ready for a lasting PEACE" and he puts the onus on Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's government.

title.children: Trump tells Israel to stop bombing Gaza, says Hamas is ready for peace

image.altText: Sean Combs, wearing a black jacket, looks neutrally off camera in front of plastered logos.

props.synopsis: A New York judge says the disgraced music mogul's violence, coercion and abuse had devastating consequences on his two former partners, and he was unconvinced that Combs would not reoffend.

title.children: Sean 'Diddy' Combs jailed for 50 months after he breaks down in court

image.altText: The grand front entrance, featuring red timber doors and stone, to the Savage Club in Melbourne

props.synopsis: These clubs, which still exist right around the country, are the weirdest anomaly. They sit jostled up against the Australia they firmly shut their doors against; their purpose in modern Australia seems almost neurotic.

title.children: A men's club so exclusive it almost blew up over the prospect of female guests

image.altText: A general view of R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo with the covers on while raining.

props.synopsis: Australia's World Cup pool match against Sri Lanka in Colombo was abandoned due to rain, with no play possible due to the inclement weather.

title.children: Aussie World Cup clash with Sri Lanka washed out

image.altText: Eliza Lopamaua runs with the ball in two hands for the Sydney Roosters during the 2025 NRLW season.

props.synopsis: As she prepares for Sunday's NRLW grand final against the Brisbane Broncos, Sydney Roosters prop Eliza Lopamaua concedes she found rugby league by mistake.

title.children: How rising Sydney Roosters ace found her way to the NRLW

image.altText: Roger Bart and Axel Duffy in character, Duffy dressed in puffer vest, Bart looking like a mad scientist, in front of car

props.synopsis: In the 1985 film Back to the Future, the DeLorean takes to the skies. So too in the musical production.

title.children: Whoever said cars can't fly hasn't seen Back to the Future the Musical

image.altText: A man with blonde hair wearing a suit speaking

props.synopsis: The move is the latest financial offer made by the Department of Homeland Security, aimed at encouraging voluntary deportations.

title.children: US offers unaccompanied migrant children cash to leave the country

image.altText: A cricket player in white with blue helmet walks off holding bat with celebrating players behind him

props.synopsis: Australia's incumbent Test opener Sam Konstas is dropped and survives two LBW appeals before being dismissed for four on day one of the Sheffield Shield.

title.children: Sam Konstas among Ashes hopefuls to fail on day one of Sheffield Shield

image.altText: Photo of Gus

props.synopsis: A week of large-scale land and air searches have found no clues leading to the whereabouts of four-year-old Gus in outback South Australia.

title.children: Why the search for a missing 4yo in SA's outback was so challenging

image.altText: Two men look on during a rugby league training session

props.synopsis: Not many players can be like Cameron Munster and Reece Walsh except for one another, and that's why they hold the fate of the 2025 NRL grand final in their hands.

title.children: The ties that bind Munster and Walsh ahead of NRL grand final showdown

image.altText: A mother covers her face in grief as a woman beside her tries to comfort her.

props.synopsis: A shocking mass grave discovery in Sri Lanka reignites global attention on one of the world's highest cases of unresolved enforced disappearances.

title.children: Old wounds reopened for Tamils as mass grave discovered since the civil war

image.altText: A yellow sign that reads "for your privacy no photography, no audio recording, no video recording".

props.synopsis: The service sits delicately at the intersection of harm reduction strategies by NSW Health and the police's work to stop illegal drug supply.

title.children: MDMA, ketamine and cocaine: What the NSW pill testing trial has uncovered

image.altText: Smokey sunset over the water at Coolum Beach QLD in October

props.synopsis: Southern and eastern Australia are forecast to see a surge of summer-like warmth, as high fire danger warnings are issued across several parts of the country.

title.children: BOM forecasts summer heat to make way for cold switch

image.altText: Woman smiles next to white bichon poodle holding to flight tickets

props.synopsis: Brisbane woman Lisa Robinson made a discrimination complaint following the incident, and the airline has implemented changes to its policy following a two-year review.

title.children: Settlement reached after woman not allowed to fly with assistance dog

image.altText: Bowl of lemon and chickpea ravioli with baby spinach leaves. It's topped with grated Parmesan cheese and Mascarpone.

props.synopsis: The dish is completely unfussy, relying upon two pantry staples, zesty lemon and salty Parmesan, to bring big, punchy flavours.

title.children: Cheesy lemon ravioli is a simple dinner with just three steps

image.altText: a river seen from a helicopter

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian woman has drowned after the raft she was travelling in flipped on the fifth day of a planned 10-day pack-rafting adventure in the remote Franklin-Gordon Wild Rivers National Park.

title.children: Woman drowns on Franklin River rafting trip

image.altText: A profile shot of a squinting older man holding a sandwich before his mouth.

props.synopsis: WA Police say significant resources were committed to finding Mark Sear, 62, but the outback's difficult conditions made search efforts challenging.

title.children: Ground search called off for man missing for two weeks in WA's outback

image.altText: A landscape shot of an alpine environment blanketed in snow.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's wild places continue to captivate travellers, but experts say it is easy to underestimate how quickly a sunny day can flip to life-threatening conditions. One SES rescuer shares his advice for staying safe in the wilderness.

title.children: Think you can handle the Overland Track? Here's what you should know

image.altText: A bald man standing on stage playing a guitar.

props.synopsis: Paul Arthurs, better known as Bonehead, posted on X: "I'm really sad to be missing these shows but I'm feeling good and will be back."

title.children: Oasis guitarist Bonehead to miss Australian shows due to cancer treatment

image.altText: A computer sitting in a dark room by a lamp shows the Pornhub logo.

props.synopsis: The number of people accessing prominent pornography websites in the United Kingdom plummets after new age-verification laws — that are also heading to Australia — are introduced.

title.children: Online porn traffic plummets in UK after law change, and Australia is next
